review: Took forever for me to set up, between getting the Chromecast to connect to wifi network, to getting it to work with the TV, to getting the iPad app to recognize the stupid thing. Worked all of once with the TV- we watched an episode of Star Trek on Netflix- then when I went to connect it with my iPad again, the iPad app wouldn't recognize.I had to go in and muck around with the wifi router settings to get it to work that first time. Not interested in scouring the internet for solutions every time I want to watch Jean Luc Picard of the USS Enterprise.Don't buy this, unless you like stress.Gonna check out either the Roku or the Apple TV instead.Boo Chromecast, boo.

review: You can now combine a small, light inexpensive piece of hardware with Google Chrome, and your smartphone, laptop or many other portable computing pieces to find video streaming online, and play it in high definition on your television on your home wifi network. It eliminates the pain of using cables, but allows you to use a browser to find and log into services you may already subscribe to or are publicly available online.Your wifi bandwidth is the limiting factor. Streaming can be choppy, but no so on our network with Chromecast.Setup is extremely easy. I got several TVs in our home set up within 10 minutes. Its a matter of plugging in the hdmi device, powering it up, finding the proper source on your TV then following the directions.My only issue is that its inconvenient on TVs that don't have enough hdmi inputs. You may find yourself manually multiplexing what you plug into your TV hdmi ports if you've already filled them. I have one TV with only one port so I have to multiplex the Chromecast with the cable input.Don't hesitate, this could open up your video viewing world broadly, and change your mind about how you pay for video services!
